tier.item: `The mother knows the boy ate the bread.'
`The mother knows the boy ate the bread.'
The mother knows the boy ate the bread.
`The mother knows that the boy arrived.'
`The mother knows that the boy arrived.'
The mother knows that the boy arrived.
`Father made the bread for me early.'
a. buwa-mu b-ez ditÚabu Ú°alli abu.
`Father made the bread for me early.'
Father made the bread for me early.
They do NOT live in Okt'omber.
`The woman washed the shirt for the man.'
`The woman washed the shirt for the man.'
The woman washed the shirt for the man.
`If you (S) had gone, you (A) would have seen him.'
`If you (S) had gone, you (A) would have seen him.'
If you (S) had gone, you (A) would have seen him.
